page.title: 03Religion,the Church at Ufton
page.content: The church of St.Michaels & All Angels,is a 13th century church consisting of Nave & Chancel.Of this only the Saxon South door remains.In the 14th century the present structure was built.The belfry was added in the 15th century.The side roofs were lowered in the 16th century.In 1860 extensive renovations took place. The Vicar comes from Radford Semele & shares services with Ufton.The weekly timetable shows 2 services each Sunday at 9.30 or 11.15 a.m.and 3.00 or 4.00p.m. + 1 or 2 services at Bascote Heath chapel. The attendance at St.Michaels & All Angels Church has been going up.At morning services about 15-20 people turn up.At early evening services about 20-25 people turn up.
